column4: Q: are there any extra packages on the DVD or is it just all-three-installdisks ?
Its [install disk of choice] + alternate + extra packages
If you have an internet connection, all the packages on the DVD are available in the rpeositories
Its GUI + GUI Installer + Text Installer + PAckages.  'Server' being "non graphical installed system" yes, not LAMP stack pre-config
Well, those packages will mostly be obsolete now, because of regular updates.
http://cdimage.ubuntu.com/releases/7.10/release/ubuntu-7.10-dvd-i386.list has a list of the packages
yeah, I know... I just want to know what those packages are.. I looked all over ubuntu.com and I can't find a description of what else is on the DVD
btw; iptables -F won't change the default DENY rule...
check the .list file (and diff it with the alternate CD)
there are drivers for ext2/3 and reiserfs support in windows
if you really want to, you can convert back to ext2, defrag, then convert back to ext3.  But theres no reason to do so
Write it up on the wiki!
pumpkinseed: in Ubuntu we use menu.lst not grub.conf (theyre the same thing)
